alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Coastal Duval; Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Gilchrist; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Marion; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 27 at 11:21AM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and northern Florida, including the following areas, in northeast Florida, Coastal Duval, Coastal Flagler, Coastal Nassau, Coastal St. Johns, Eastern Clay, Eastern Putnam, Inland Flagler, Inland St. Johns, South Central Duval, Trout River, Western Clay, Western Duval and Western Putnam. In northern Florida, Bradford, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Eastern Marion, Gilchrist, Western Alachua and Western Marion. * WHEN...Through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a Flood Watch for portions of northeast Florida. Heavy rainfall of 9 to 12 inches is forecast, which may lead to flooding. Locally higher amounts will be possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
